handily.英释: if you win something handily, you win easily

federal.英释: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

bargain.英释: to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

battery.英释: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

declare.英释: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

overeat.英释: to eat too much, or eat more than is healthy

aimless.英释: not having a clear purpose or reason

descend.英释: to move from a higher level to a lower one

fertile.英释: fertile land or soil is able to produce good crops

deceive.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true

calibre.英释: the level of quality or ability that someone or something has achieved

feature.英释: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical

formula.英释: a method or set of principles that you use to solve a problem or to make sure that something is successful

release.英释: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

dispute.英释: to argue or disagree with someone

ailment.英释: an illness that is not very serious

interns.英释: An intern is an advanced student or a recent graduate, especially in medicine, who is being given practical training under supervision

execute.英释: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

torrent.英释: a large amount of water moving very quickly and strongly in a particular direction

signify.英释: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

granite.英释: a very hard grey rock, often used in building

enforce.中释: 强迫服从；实施，执行；加强
enforce.英释: to make people obey a rule or law

fidgety.中释: 坐立不安的，烦躁不安的
fidgety.英释: unable to stay still, especially because of being bored or nervous

outcast.英释: someone who is not accepted by the people they live among, or who has been forced out of their home

organic.英释: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

combine.英释: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

vehicle.英释: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

imitate.英释: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

convert.英释: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

amplify.英释: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

eternal.英释: continuing for ever and having no end

privacy.英释: the state of being able to be alone, and not seen or heard by other people

various.英释: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

complex.英释: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

amateur.英释: someone who you think is not very skilled at something

implant.英释: to strongly fix an idea, feeling, attitude etc in someone’s mind or character

faculty.英释: all the teachers in a university

embrace.英释: to put your arms around someone and hold them in a friendly or loving way

banquet.英释: a formal dinner for many people on an important occasion

enclose.英释: to put something inside an envelope as well as a letter

barrier.英释: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

awkward.英释: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

address.英释: if you address an envelope, package etc, you write on it the name and address of the person you are sending it to

receipt.英释: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

plumber.英释: someone whose job is to repair water pipes, baths, toilets etc

trigger.英释: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it

valiant.英释: very brave, especially in a difficult situation

upgrade.英释: to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things

inspire.英释: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

deliver.英释: to give something such as a blow, shock, or warning to someone or something

utilize.英释: to use something for a particular purpose

dynamic.英释: full of energy and new ideas, and determined to succeed

autopsy.英释: an examination of a dead body to discover the cause of death

gesture.英释: to move your hand, arm, or head to tell someone something, or show them what you mean

boarder.英释: a student who stays at a school during the night, as well as during the day

bracket.英释: one of the pair of signs ( ) put around words to show extra information

concept.英释: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

crucial.英释: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

blister.英释: a swelling on your skin containing clear liquid, caused, for example, by a burn or continuous rubbing

session.中释: （法庭，议会等）会议，开会；学期；学年
session.英释: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

corrupt.中释: 腐败的，贪污的；堕落的vt.使出错，破坏
corrupt.英释: using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

torment.英释: to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

virtual.英释: You can use virtual to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true

monsoon.英释: the season, from about April to October, when it rains a lot in India and other southern Asian countries

relieve.英释: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

whistle.英释: a small object that produces a high whistling sound when you blow into it

deprive.英释: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

pyramid.英释: a large stone building with four  triangular (= three-sided )  walls that slope in to a point at the top, especially in Egypt and Central America

prolong.英释: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

startle.英释: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

symptom.英释: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

consult.英释: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

neglect.英释: to fail to look after someone or something properly

produce.英释: to cause a particular result or effect

welfare.英释: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

protest.英释: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something

revenue.英释: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

essence.英释: the most basic and important quality of something

seizure.中释: 没收；夺取；捕获；（疾病的）突然发作
seizure.英释: the act of suddenly taking control of something, especially by force

dismiss.中释: 解散；解雇；开除；让离开；不予理会、不予考虑
dismiss.英释: to remove someone from their job

mercury.英释: Mercury is a silver-coloured liquid metal that is used especially in thermometers and barometers

routine.英释: happening as a normal part of a job or process

fiction.英释: books and stories about imaginary people and events

calcium.英释: a silver-white metal that helps to form teeth, bones, and  chalk  . It is a chemical  element  : symbol Ca

auction.英释: a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

commute.英释: A commute is the journey that you make when you commute

trouble.英释: to say something or ask someone to do something which may use or waste their time or upset them

traitor.中释: 叛徒；卖国贼；背信弃义的人
traitor.英释: someone who is not loyal to their country, friends, or beliefs

episode.中释: 插曲；一段情节；插话；有趣的事件
episode.英释: a television or radio programme that is one of a series of programmes in which the same story is continued each week

hostage.英释: someone who is kept as a prisoner by an enemy so that the other side will do what the enemy demands

topsoil.英释: the upper level of soil in which most plants have their roots

plunder.英释: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war

freebie.中释: 免费的东西；免费赠品（尤指戏院赠券）
freebie.英释: something that you are given free, usually by a company

consent.中释: 同意；（意见等的）一致；赞成

dwindle.英释: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

paradox.中释: 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事
paradox.英释: a situation that seems strange because it involves two ideas or qualities that are very different

elevate.中释: 提升；举起；振奋情绪等；提升…的职位
elevate.英释: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

lobster.英释: a sea animal with eight legs, a shell, and two large claws

distort.英释: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

improve.英释: to make something better, or to become better

miserly.英释: a miserly person is not generous and does not like spending money

dynasty.英释: a family of kings or other rulers whose parents, grandparents etc have ruled the country for many years

cordial.中释: 补品；兴奋剂；甜香酒，甘露酒

scandal.中释: 丑闻；流言蜚语；诽谤；公愤
scandal.英释: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people

discern.英释: If you can discern something, you are aware of it and know what it is

carcass.中释: （人或动物的）尸体；残骸；（除脏去头备食用的）畜体
carcass.英释: the body of a dead animal

graphic.中释: 形象的；图表的；绘画似的
graphic.英释: connected with or including drawing, printing, or designing

present.英释: something you give someone on a special occasion or to thank them for something

process.中释: 经过特殊加工（或处理）的

goddess.英释: a female  being  who is believed to control the world or part of it, or represents a particular quality

stutter.英释: an inability to speak normally because you stutter

subsidy.英释: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

evident.英释: easy to see, notice, or understand

dubious.中释: 可疑的；暧昧的；无把握的；半信半疑的
dubious.英释: probably not honest, true, right etc

refresh.中释: 更新；使……恢复；使……清新；消除……的疲劳
refresh.英释: if you refresh your computer screen while you are connected to the Internet, you make the screen show any new information that has arrived since you first began looking at it

swollen.中释: 肿胀的，浮肿的；浮夸的；激动兴奋的
swollen.英释: a part of your body that is swollen is bigger than usual, especially because you are ill or injured

scooter.中释: 小轮摩托车；速可达；单脚滑行车；小孩滑板车
scooter.英释: a type of small, less powerful  motorcycle  with small wheels

stretch.英释: the action of stretching a part of your body out to its full length, or a particular way of doing this

depress.英释: to make someone feel very unhappy

ferment.英释: if fruit, beer, wine etc ferments, or if it is fermented, the sugar in it changes to alcohol

prevent.英释: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

habitat.英释: the natural home of a plant or animal

pumpkin.英释: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit

treason.英释: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence

embargo.英释: an official order to stop trade with another country

abdomen.英释: the part of your body between your chest and legs which contains your stomach,  bowel s  etc

caravan.中释: 乘拖车度假；参加旅行队旅行

testify.英释: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

confess.英释: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

consume.英释: to use time, energy, goods etc

enlarge.英释: if you enlarge something, or if it enlarges, it increases in size or scale

besiege.英释: to surround a city or castle with military force until the people inside let you take control

fission.中释: 裂变；分裂；分体；分裂生殖法
fission.英释: the process of splitting an atom to produce large amounts of energy or an explosion

dilemma.中释: 困境；进退两难；两刀论法
dilemma.英释: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

demerit.英释: a bad quality or feature of something

justify.英释: To justify a decision, action, or idea means to show or prove that it is reasonable or necessary

magnify.英释: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

seminar.英释: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

lighter.中释: 明亮的；光明的；照明好的；光线充足的

diffuse.英释: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this

patriot.英释: someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval

survive.中释: 幸存；生还；幸免于；比活得长
survive.英释: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

confine.英释: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject

dictate.英释: an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

herring.英释: a long thin silver sea fish that can be eaten

leopard.英释: a large animal of the cat family, with yellow fur and black spots, which lives in Africa and South Asia

prevail.英释: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

burglar.英释: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

slender.英释: thin in an attractive or graceful way

dioxide.英释: a chemical  compound  that contains two atoms of oxygen and one atom of another chemical  element

tornado.中释: [气象] 龙卷风；旋风；暴风；大雷雨
tornado.英释: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

skilled.中释: 熟练的；有技能的；需要技能的
skilled.英释: someone who is skilled has the training and experience that is needed to do something well

narrate.英释: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

verdict.英释: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

seasick.英释: feeling ill when you travel in a boat, because of the movement of the boat in the water

decimal.英释: a  fraction (= a number less than 1 )  that is shown as a  full stop  followed by the number of  tenth s  ,  hundredth s  etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.

precede.英释: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

readily.中释: 容易地；乐意地；无困难地

curable.中释: 可治愈的；可医治的；可矫正的
curable.英释: an illness that is curable can be cured

seaweed.英释: a plant that grows in the sea

special.英释: not ordinary or usual, but different in some way and often better or more important

cobbler.中释: 补鞋匠；工匠；冷饮料；脆皮水果馅饼
cobbler.英释: cooked fruit covered with a sweet bread-like mixture

gateway.英释: the opening in a fence, wall etc that can be closed by a gate

janitor.英释: someone whose job is to look after a school or other large building

passion.英释: a very strong belief or feeling about something

poverty.英释: the situation or experience of being poor

tribute.中释: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
tribute.英释: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

fascism.中释: 法西斯主义；极端国家主义
fascism.英释: a  right-wing  political system in which people’s lives are completely controlled by the state and no political opposition is allowed

twinkle.英释: an expression in your eyes that shows you are happy or amused

cookery.英释: the art or skill of cooking

darling.英释: used when speaking to someone you love

possess.中释: 控制；使掌握；持有；迷住；拥有，具备
possess.英释: to have a particular quality or ability

whisker.英释: one of the long stiff hairs that grow near the mouth of a cat, mouse etc

stiffen.英释: to become stronger, more severe, or more determined, or to make something do this

surpass.中释: 超越；胜过，优于；非…所能办到或理解
surpass.英释: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

express.中释: 快车，快递，专使；捷运公司
express.英释: a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

predict.英释: to say that something will happen, before it happens

decibel.英释: a unit for measuring the loudness of sound

zoology.英释: the scientific study of animals and their behaviour

interim.中释: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
interim.英释: in the period of time between two events

coastal.英释: in the sea or on the land near the coast

proudly.中释: 傲慢地，自负地；得意洋洋地

deficit.英释: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

lunatic.英释: someone who behaves in a crazy or very stupid way – often used humorously

eardrum.英释: a tight thin piece of skin over the inside of your ear which allows you to hear sound

diction.英释: the choice and use of words and phrases to express meaning, especially in literature

freight.英释: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods

inhuman.中释: 残忍的；野蛮的；无人性的
inhuman.英释: very cruel or without any normal feelings of pity

gorilla.英释: a very large African monkey that is the largest of the  apes

reflect.中释: 反映；反射，照出；表达；显示;反省
reflect.英释: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

massage.英释: the action of pressing and rubbing someone’s body with your hands, to help them relax or to reduce pain in their muscles or joints

indulge.中释: 满足；纵容；使高兴；使沉迷于…
indulge.英释: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

thereof.中释: 它的；由此；在其中；关于…；将它
thereof.英释: relating to something that has just been mentioned

vibrate.英释: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

observe.英释: If you observe an important day such as a holiday or anniversary, you do something special in order to honour or celebrate it

cricket.英释: a game between two teams of 11 players in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running between two sets of three sticks

keynote.中释: 给…定基调；说明基本政策

nostril.英释: one of the two holes at the end of your nose, through which you breathe and smell things

chariot.中释: 驾驭（过去式charioted，过去分词charioted，现在分词charioting，第三人称单数chariots）

estuary.英释: the wide part of a river where it goes into the sea

ketchup.英释: a thick cold red sauce made from tomatoes that you put on food

malaria.英释: a disease that is common in hot countries and that you get when a type of  mosquito  bites you

exhibit.英释: something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

distant.中释: 遥远的；冷漠的；远隔的；不友好的，冷淡的
distant.英释: far away in space or time

algebra.英释: a type of mathematics that uses letters and other signs to represent numbers and values

nourish.英释: to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy

walkway.英释: an outdoor path built for people to walk along, often above the ground

liberty.英释: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority

preside.英释: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

elegant.中释: 高雅的，优雅的；讲究的；简炼的；简洁的

provoke.英释: to cause a reaction or feeling, especially a sudden one

antonym.英释: a word that means the opposite of another word

restore.英释: to make something return to its former state or condition

fireman.中释: 消防队员；救火队员；锅炉工
fireman.英释: a man whose job is to stop fires burning

ellipse.英释: a curved shape like a circle, but with two slightly longer and flatter sides

drizzle.英释: weather that is a combination of light rain and mist

dustpan.英释: a flat container with a handle that you use with a brush to remove dust and waste from the floor

miracle.中释: 奇迹，奇迹般的人或物；惊人的事例
miracle.英释: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

liaison.英释: the regular exchange of information between groups of people, especially at work, so that each group knows what the other is doing

climate.英释: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

colonel.英释: a high rank in the army, Marines, or the US air force, or someone who has this rank

journal.英释: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest

overdue.英释: not done, paid, returned etc by the time expected

setting.中释: 放置；沉没；使…处于某位置（set的ing形式）

Marxism.中释: 马克思的；马克思主义的

spinach.英释: a vegetable with large dark green leaves

anxiety.中释: 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事
anxiety.英释: the feeling of being very worried about something

savoury.中释: 可口的；开胃的；令人愉快的
savoury.英释: a savoury smell or taste is strong and pleasant but is not sweet

smuggle.英释: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

grenade.中释: 扔手榴弹；用催泪弹攻击

contain.中释: 包含；控制；容纳；牵制（敌军）
contain.英释: if something such as a bag, box, or place contains something, that thing is inside it

therapy.英释: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

toenail.英释: the hard part that covers the top of each of your toes

exhaust.英释: a pipe on a car or machine that waste gases pass through

unearth.中释: 发掘；揭露，发现；从洞中赶出
unearth.英释: to find something after searching for it, especially something that has been buried in the ground or lost for a long time

empress.英释: a female ruler of an empire, or the wife of an emperor

earnest.英释: if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

warrant.英释: to promise that something is true

parlour.英释: a room in a house which has comfortable chairs and is used for meeting guests

charter.英释: a statement of the principles, duties, and purposes of an organization

mention.英释: when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

villain.中释: 坏人，恶棍；戏剧、小说中的反派角色；顽童；罪犯
villain.英释: the main bad character in a film, play, or story

Karaoke.中释: 卡拉OK；卡拉OK录音，自动伴奏录音
Karaoke.英释: Karaoke is a form of entertainment in which a machine plays the tunes of songs, and people take turns singing the words

cyclone.中释: 旋风；[气象] 气旋；飓风
cyclone.英释: a very strong wind that moves very fast in a circle

horizon.中释: [天] 地平线；视野；眼界；范围
horizon.英释: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

furnace.英释: a large container for a very hot fire, used to produce power, heat, or liquid metal

surgery.中释: 外科；外科手术；手术室；诊疗室
surgery.英释: medical treatment in which a surgeon cuts open your body to repair or remove something inside

cherish.英释: if you cherish something, it is very important to you

pasture.英释: to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

savings.中释: 储蓄；存款；救助；节省物（saving的复数形式）
savings.英释: A saving is a reduction in the amount of time or money that is used or needed

vacancy.英释: a job that is available for someone to start doing

solicit.英释: to ask someone for money, help, or information

cruelty.英释: behaviour or actions that deliberately cause pain to people or animals

geology.英释: the study of the rocks, soil etc that make up the Earth, and of the way they have changed since the Earth was formed

sterile.中释: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
sterile.英释: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

imagine.英释: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

unusual.中释: 不寻常的；与众不同的；不平常的
unusual.英释: different from what is usual or normal

antenna.中释: [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须
antenna.英释: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

visible.中释: 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目

whereby.英释: by means of which or according to which

flavour.英释: to give something a particular taste or more taste

persist.英释: to continue to do something, although this is difficult, or other people oppose it

desktop.英释: the main area on a computer where you can find the  icon s  that represent programs, and where you can do things to manage the information on the computer

grocery.英释: food and other goods that are sold by a grocer or a supermarket

bastard.英释: someone who was born to parents who were not married

despise.英释: to dislike and have a low opinion of someone or something

silicon.英释: a chemical substance that exists as a solid or as a powder and is used to make glass, bricks, and parts for computers. It is a chemical element: symbol Si

retreat.英释: to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

extreme.中释: 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物
extreme.英释: a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

pastime.英释: something that you do because you think it is enjoyable or interesting

charity.中释: 慈善；施舍；慈善团体；宽容；施舍物
charity.英释: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

cannery.英释: a factory where food is put into cans

harmony.英释: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

scenery.英释: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

aquatic.中释: 水上运动；水生植物或动物

founder.英释: someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc

factual.英释: based on facts or relating to facts

suspend.中释: 延缓，推迟；使暂停；使悬浮
suspend.英释: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

portray.英释: to describe or represent something or someone

violent.英释: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

regency.英释: a period of government by a  regent (= person who governs instead of a king or queen )

serpent.中释: 蛇（尤指大蛇或毒蛇）；狡猾的人
serpent.英释: a snake, especially a large one

thought.中释: 想，思考；认为（think的过去式和过去分词）

undergo.英释: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

elastic.英释: Elastic is a rubber material that stretches when you pull it and returns to its original size and shape when you let it go. Elastic is often used in clothes to make them fit tightly, for example, around the waist.

marshal.英释: to organize your thoughts, ideas etc so that they are clear, effective, or easy to understand

magical.英释: relating to magic or able to do magic

grumble.英释: If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way

dissect.英释: to examine something carefully in order to understand it

element.中释: 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境
element.英释: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

version.英释: a copy of something that has been changed so that it is slightly different

intense.中释: 强烈的；紧张的；非常的；热情的
intense.英释: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

compile.中释: 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编
compile.英释: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

envious.英释: wanting something that someone else has

gourmet.英释: Gourmet food is nicer or more unusual or sophisticated than ordinary food, and is often more expensive

comment.英释: to express an opinion about someone or something

provide.英释: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

patient.英释: someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

shorten.英释: to become shorter or make something shorter

haughty.英释: behaving in a proud unfriendly way

chamber.中释: 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

drought.英释: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

custody.英释: the right to take care of a child, given to one of their parents when they have  divorced

orchard.英释: a place where fruit trees are grown

swallow.英释: a small black and white bird that comes to northern countries in the summer

outline.英释: to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

escapee.英释: someone who has escaped from somewhere

inexact.中释: 不精确的；不严格的；不正确的

grimace.英释: an expression you make by twisting your face because you do not like something or because you are feeling pain

average.中释: 算出…的平均数；将…平均分配；使…平衡
average.英释: to usually do something or usually happen a particular number of times, or to usually be a particular size or amount

rebirth.英释: when an important idea, feeling, or organization becomes strong or popular again

pronoun.英释: a word that is used instead of a noun or noun phrase, such as ‘he’ instead of ‘Peter’ or ‘the man’

attempt.英释: to try to do something, especially something difficult

acquire.英释: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

glorify.中释: 赞美；美化；崇拜（神）；使更壮丽
glorify.英释: to make someone or something seem more important or better than they really are

applaud.英释: to express strong approval of an idea, plan etc

worship.英释: to show respect and love for a god, especially by praying in a religious building

deserve.英释: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

anatomy.英释: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

coinage.中释: 造币；[金融] 货币制度；新造的字及其语等
coinage.英释: the system or type of money used in a country

economy.英释: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

silvery.中释: 银色的；清脆的；银铃一般的；似银的
silvery.英释: a silvery voice or sound is light, pleasant, and musical

stapler.中释: [轻] 订书机；主要商品批发商；把羊毛分级的人
stapler.英释: a tool used for putting staples into paper

absolve.英释: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

examine.中释: 检查；调查； 检测；考试
examine.英释: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

overall.英释: a loose-fitting piece of clothing like a coat, that is worn over clothes to protect them

yoghurt.英释: a thick liquid food that tastes slightly sour and is made from milk, or an amount of this food

mislead.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

spanner.中释: 扳手；螺丝扳手；测量器；用手掌量的人
spanner.英释: a metal tool that fits over a  nut  , used for turning the nut to make it tight or to undo it

emotion.英释: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

enchant.英释: In fairy tales and legends, to enchant someone or something means to put a magic spell on them

handgun.英释: a small gun that you hold in one hand when you fire it

minimum.英释: the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

default.中释: 违约；缺席；缺乏；系统默认值
default.英释: failure to pay money that you owe at the right time

secular.中释: 修道院外的教士，(对宗教家而言的) 俗人

despair.英释: to feel that there is no hope at all

general.英释: an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

eyelash.英释: one of the small hairs that grow along the edge of your eyelids

ashtray.英释: a small dish where you put used cigarettes

commend.英释: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

ceramic.英释: Ceramic is clay that has been heated to a very high temperature so that it becomes hard

prelude.中释: 成为…的序幕；演奏…作为前奏曲

immense.中释: 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

engrave.英释: to cut words or designs on metal, wood, glass etc

analogy.英释: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

install.英释: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

sponsor.英释: to give money to a sports event, theatre, institution etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise

gravity.中释: 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严
gravity.英释: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

earthly.英释: connected with life on Earth rather than in heaven

collide.英释: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

vitamin.中释: [生化] 维生素；[生化] 维他命
vitamin.英释: a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health

gaseous.中释: 气态的，气体的；无实质的
gaseous.英释: like gas or in the form of gas

jealous.中释: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
jealous.英释: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

penguin.英释: a large black and white Antarctic sea bird, which cannot fly but uses its wings for swimming

descent.中释: 除去…的气味；使…失去香味

halfway.英释: at a middle point in space or time between two things

rehouse.中释: 供以新住宅；使移住新居
rehouse.英释: If someone is rehoused, their local government or other authority provides them with a different house to live in

caliber.中释: [军] 口径；才干；水准（等于calibre）；器量

violate.英释: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

delight.英释: to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

obscure.中释: 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

dietary.中释: 饮食的，饭食的，规定食物的
dietary.英释: related to the food someone eats

pudding.英释: a hot sweet dish, made from cake, rice, bread etc with fruit, milk, or other sweet things added

context.英释: the situation, events, or information that are related to something and that help you to understand it

extract.英释: a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

genuine.英释: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

convict.英释: someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

premier.英释: a  prime minister  – used in news reports

tedious.英释: something that is tedious continues for a long time and is not interesting

sparkle.英释: to shine in small bright flashes

airbase.英释: a place where military aircraft begin and end their flights, and where members of an air force live

capture.英释: when you catch someone in order to make them a prisoner

thinker.英释: someone who thinks carefully about important subjects such as science or  philosophy  , especially someone who is famous for thinking of new ideas

aspirin.英释: a medicine that reduces pain,  inflammation  , and fever

surplus.英释: more than what is needed or used

failure.英释: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

wrinkle.英释: if you wrinkle a part of your face, or if it wrinkles, small lines appear on it

involve.中释: 包含；牵涉；使陷于；潜心于
involve.英释: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

cavalry.英释: the part of an army that fights on horses, especially in the past

glimpse.英释: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them

prophet.英释: a man who people in the Christian, Jewish, or Muslim religion believe has been sent by God to lead them and teach them their religion

preface.英释: If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first

compose.中释: 构成；写作；使平静；排…的版
compose.英释: to write a piece of music

bladder.中释: 膀胱；囊状物，可充气的囊袋
bladder.英释: the organ in your body that holds  urine (=  waste liquid  )  until it is passed out of your body

flyover.英释: a bridge that takes one road over another road

somehow.中释: 以某种方法；莫名其妙地

bristle.英释: to behave in a way that shows you are very angry or annoyed

upright.英释: a long piece of wood or metal that stands straight up and supports something

flatter.英释: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

tragedy.英释: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

veranda.英释: an open area with a floor and a roof that is attached to the side of a house at ground level

torture.英释: an act of deliberately hurting someone in order to force them to tell you something, to punish them, or to be cruel

cynical.英释: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

disgust.英释: To disgust someone means to make them feel a strong sense of dislike and disapproval

clamour.英释: a very loud noise made by a large group of people or animals

witness.英释: to see something happen, especially a crime or accident

Jupiter.中释: [天] 木星；朱庇特（罗马神话中的宙斯神）
Jupiter.英释: the planet that is fifth in order from the sun and is the largest in the solar system

replace.中释: 取代，代替；替换，更换；归还，偿还；把…放回原处
replace.英释: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

insight.英释: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

council.中释: 委员会；会议；理事会；地方议会；顾问班子
council.英释: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

ostrich.英释: a large African bird with long legs, that runs very quickly but cannot fly

confirm.中释: 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固
confirm.英释: to show that something is definitely true, especially by providing more proof

cunning.英释: the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

admiral.中释: 海军上将；舰队司令；旗舰
admiral.英释: a high rank in the British or US navy, or someone with this rank

offence.英释: an illegal action or a crime

contest.英释: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

diverse.中释: 不同的；多种多样的；变化多的
diverse.英释: If a group of things is diverse, it is made up of a wide variety of things

deposit.英释: to put something down in a particular place

conifer.中释: 针叶树；[植] 松柏科植物
conifer.英释: a tree such as a  pine  or  fir  that has leaves like needles and produces brown  cones  that contain seeds. Most types of conifer keep their leaves in winter.

massive.中释: 大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

funfair.英释: a noisy outdoor event where you can ride on machines, play games to win prizes etc

support.中释: 支持，维持；支援，供养；支持者，支撑物
support.英释: approval, encouragement, and perhaps help for a person, idea, plan etc

neutral.中释: 中立国；中立者；非彩色；齿轮的空档
neutral.英释: a country, person, or group that is not involved in an argument or disagreement

further.英释: If you further something, you help it to progress, to be successful, or to be achieved

selfish.英释: caring only about yourself and not about other people – used to show disapproval

trickle.英释: a thin slow flow of liquid

closely.中释: 紧密地；接近地；严密地；亲近地

alcohol.英释: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

poultry.英释: birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept on farms in order to produce eggs and meat

inflate.英释: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

majesty.中释: 威严；最高权威，王权；雄伟；权威
majesty.英释: the quality that something big has of being impressive, powerful, or beautiful

freezer.英释: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment in which food can be stored at very low temperatures for a long time

assault.英释: to attack someone in a violent way

sausage.中释: 香肠；腊肠；装香肠的碎肉
sausage.英释: a small tube of skin filled with a mixture of meat, spices etc, eaten hot or cold after it has been cooked

perplex.中释: 使困惑，使为难；使复杂化
perplex.英释: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

entrant.中释: 进入者；新会员；参加竞赛者；新工作者
entrant.英释: someone who takes part in a competition

jeweler.中释: 珠宝商；宝石匠；钟表匠；钟表商

paddock.英释: a small field in which horses are kept

ecology.英释: the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this

ammeter.中释: [电] 安培计；[电] 电流计
ammeter.英释: a piece of equipment used to measure the strength of an electric current

pottery.中释: 陶器；陶器厂；陶器制造术
pottery.英释: objects made out of baked clay

chatter.中释: 唠叨；饶舌；（动物的）啁啾声；潺潺流水声
chatter.英释: talk, especially about things that are not serious or important

Celsius.英释: a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 0˚ and boils at 100˚

eyesore.英释: something that is very ugly, especially a building surrounded by other things that are not ugly

phoenix.英释: a magic bird that is born from a fire, according to ancient stories

venture.英释: a new business activity that involves taking risks

realize.中释: 实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得，把(证券等)变成现钱；变卖
realize.英释: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

abolish.英释: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

satchel.英释: a leather bag that you carry over your shoulder, used especially in the past by children for carrying books to school

premise.中释: 前提；上述各项；房屋连地基
premise.英释: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

clarity.英释: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

abridge.英释: to reduce the length of (a written work) by condensing or rewriting

revenge.英释: to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

lottery.中释: 彩票；碰运气的事，难算计的事；抽彩给奖法
lottery.英释: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

dissent.英释: refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion

lightly.中释: 轻轻地；轻松地；容易地；不费力地
lightly.英释: with only a small amount of weight or force

uncover.英释: to find out about something that has been kept secret

careful.英释: used to tell someone to think about what they are doing so that something bad does not happen

volcano.英释: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava(= very hot liquid rock ) is sometimes forced out

playful.中释: 开玩笑的；幽默的；爱嬉戏的
playful.英释: very active, happy, and wanting to have fun

decline.英释: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

crusade.中释: 加入十字军；从事改革运动
crusade.英释: to take part in a crusade

disdain.英释: to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough

setback.英释: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

whereas.英释: used at the beginning of an official document to mean ‘because of a particular fact’

statute.英释: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

overlap.中释: 部分重叠；部分的同时发生
overlap.英释: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.

abandon.英释: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

buffalo.中释: [畜牧][脊椎] 水牛；[脊椎] 野牛（产于北美）；水陆两用坦克
buffalo.英释: an African animal similar to a large cow with long curved horns

warfare.英释: the activity of fighting in a war – used especially when talking about particular methods of fighting

dolphin.英释: a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose

syringe.英释: an instrument for taking blood from someone’s body or putting liquid, drugs etc into it, consisting of a hollow plastic tube and a needle

current.英释: a continuous movement of water in a river, lake, or sea

squeeze.英释: a situation in which there is only just enough room for things or people to fit somewhere

glimmer.英释: to shine with a light that is not very bright

referee.英释: to be the referee of a game

deathly.英释: If you say that someone is deathly pale or deathly still, you are emphasizing that they are very pale or still, like a dead person

reunite.中释: 使重聚；使再结合；使再联合
reunite.英释: to come together again or to bring people, parts of an organization, political party, or country together again

eminent.英释: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

partial.中释: 局部的；偏爱的；不公平的

glitter.英释: brightness consisting of many flashing points of light

confuse.英释: to make someone feel that they cannot think clearly or do not understand

exclude.中释: 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

lettuce.英释: a round vegetable with thin green leaves eaten raw in salads

mystery.中释: 秘密，谜；神秘，神秘的事物；推理小说，推理剧；常作 mysteries 秘技，秘诀
mystery.英释: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

discard.中释: 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人

disable.中释: 使失去能力；使残废；使无资格
disable.英释: to make someone unable to use a part of their body properly

reprint.英释: an occasion when more copies of a book are printed because all the copies of it have been sold

recruit.中释: 补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康

thereby.中释: 从而，因此；在那附近；在那方面
thereby.英释: with the result that something else happens

benefit.英释: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

equally.中释: 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地
equally.英释: to the same degree or amount

synonym.英释: a word with the same meaning as another word in the same language

ammonia.英释: a clear liquid with a strong bad smell that is used for cleaning or in cleaning products

slander.英释: a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person

brewery.英释: a place where beer is made, or a company that makes beer

trivial.中释: 不重要的，琐碎的；琐细的

compete.英释: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

deflect.英释: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction

explore.英释: to discuss or think about something carefully

acrobat.中释: 杂技演员，特技演员；随机应变者；翻云覆雨者，善变者
acrobat.英释: someone who entertains people by doing difficult physical actions such as walking on their hands or balancing on a high rope, especially at a  circus

sawmill.英释: a factory where trees are cut into flat pieces that can be used as wood

stammer.英释: a speech problem which makes someone speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds

saunter.英释: to walk in a slow relaxed way, especially so that you look confident or proud

condemn.英释: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

gallows.英释: a structure used for killing criminals by hanging from a rope

seaport.英释: a large town on or near a coast, with a  harbour  that big ships can use

entitle.中释: 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利
entitle.英释: to give someone the official right to do or have something

approve.英释: to officially accept a plan, proposal etc

fashion.英释: to shape or make something, using your hands or only a few tools

roadway.中释: 道路；路面；车行道；铁路的路基
roadway.英释: the part of the road used by vehicles

include.英释: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

scarlet.中释: 猩红色；红衣；绯红色；鲜红色布

concern.中释: 关系；关心；关心的事；忧虑
concern.英释: something that is important to you or that involves you

insider.中释: 内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者
insider.英释: someone who has a special knowledge of a particular organization because they are part of it

shutter.中释: 为…装百叶窗；以百叶窗遮闭

fascist.中释: 法西斯主义的，法西斯党的
fascist.英释: You use fascist to describe organizations, ideas, or systems which follow the principles of fascism

remains.英释: the parts of something that are left after the rest has been destroyed or has disappeared

naughty.中释: 顽皮的，淘气的；不听话的；没规矩的；不适当的；下流的
naughty.英释: a naughty child does not obey adults and behaves badly

outcome.英释: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

typical.中释: 典型的；特有的；象征性的
typical.英释: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

coconut.英释: the large brown seed of a tropical tree, which has a hard shell containing white flesh that you can eat and a milky liquid that you can drink

refrain.英释: part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each  verse

calorie.英释: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

crimson.英释: if your face crimsons, it becomes red because you are embarrassed

academy.中释: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
academy.英释: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

alumnus.英释: a former student of a school, college etc

scratch.英释: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

utensil.英释: a thing such as a knife, spoon etc that you use when you are cooking

capable.中释: 能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

segment.英释: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

inherit.英释: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

removal.英释: when someone is forced out of an important position or dismissed from a job

eyeball.英释: to look directly and closely at something or someone

payable.中释: 应付的；到期的；可付的；可获利的
payable.英释: a bill, debt etc that is payable must be paid

oppress.中释: 压迫，压抑；使……烦恼；使……感到沉重
oppress.英释: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have

modesty.英释: a modest way of behaving or talking

robbery.英释: the crime of stealing money or things from a bank, shop etc, especially using violence

penalty.英释: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

seafood.英释: animals from the sea that you can eat, for example fish and  shellfish

sorghum.中释: 高粱；[作物] 蜀黍；甜得发腻的东西
sorghum.英释: a type of grain that is grown in tropical areas
